item.title: [317] Checking for item when using object
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:4, topic:328826”]if(objectID == 3032) { sendMessage(playerHasItemAmount(id, amount) ? "You are trying to fish with a small fishing net." : "You don't have a small fishing net nub!"); }[/quote]

Hmm. Nice one, that would save a few lines of code.

Anyway, I stumbled onto the next problem, the fishing emotes.
I searched for some gfx-lists, and all fishing emotes are on it (lobster pot, fishing rod, harpooning), but netting isn’t.

Does anyone know the netting gfx ID?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Checking for item when using object
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Oh-Noes:

playerHasItem(id, amount)

Well duh. How could I have missed that one.
Goes and grabs another cup of coffee

Thanks ;D

item.title: [317] Checking for item when using object
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Hey all,

I’m in the process of adding Fishing to my server, but ran into a problem.
When a player uses a fishing spot, I want to check if they have the appropriate fishing gear.

I was thinking about using getItemSlot, but that didn’t work out for me.
I was using this code for it:

if (objectID == 3032) { if (getItemSlot(304) > 0) { sM("You are trying to fish with a small fishing net."); } else { sM("You don't have a small fishing net nub!"); } }

But like i said, that didn’t work. So, what would be the better method to check if a player has an item?

Regards, SirPali

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Checking for item when using object
